definition: Socrates (469-399 BC), Greek philosopher/José Sócrates (1957-), prime minister of Portugal (2005-2011)
Perilla frutescens (Chinese basil or wild red basil)/place name/to revive/used as phonetic in transliteration
surname Su/abbr. for Soviet Union 蘇維埃|苏维埃 or 蘇聯|苏联/abbr. for Jiangsu province 江蘇|江苏/abbr. for Suzhou city 蘇州|苏州
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base

sentences.chinese: 蘇格拉底的作法相對唐突。

sentences.english: Pre-Socratic natural Philosopher, member of the Ionian School.
sentences.chinese: 前蘇格拉底自然哲學家，伊奧尼亞學派成員。

sentences.english: Which one legislates for mankind ? at the time of Socrates?
sentences.chinese: 那一種是蘇格拉底時期，人類的真正立法者？

sentences.english: Starting with Socrates, philosophers have been searching for the eternal verities.
sentences.chinese: 自蘇格拉底以降，哲學家一直在追尋永恆的真理。

sentences.english: But suppose someone asks us, 'Socrates and Diotima.
sentences.chinese: 請問，蘇格拉底，凡是愛善者所愛的究竟是什麼？
蘇格拉底是女性主義嗎？

sentences.english: It gives you a little idea of the character of Socrates.
sentences.chinese: 這讓我們瞥見蘇格拉底個性的一面。
還有哲學傾向的蘇格拉底。

sentences.english: BC - The philosopher Socrates is sentenced to death.
sentences.chinese: 公元前399年的今天，哲學家蘇格拉底被宣判死刑。

sentences.english: It is not merely Socrates who is on trial.
sentences.chinese: 不單僅是蘇格拉底受審。

sentences.english: In that relationship, why should Alcibiades be concerned with himself, and why is Socrates concerned with that concern of Alcibiades?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼蘇格拉底要關心到阿希比底思的關心？

sentences.english: Maybe, to speak bluntly, Socrates just doesn't care that much about them.
sentences.chinese: 更直接的說，蘇格拉底根本不管這些人。

sentences.english: In Book VII of the Republic Socrates presents the allegory as follows.
sentences.chinese: 在《理想國》第七卷，蘇格拉底講述了這個比喻。

sentences.english: In order to show that he was an eloquent speaker, the young man
sentences.chinese: 一個年輕人請蘇格拉底教他演講術。

sentences.english: Hippias thinks Socrates is complimenting him.
sentences.chinese: 希比阿以爲蘇格拉底在誇獎他。

definition: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
dialectics/dialectic or Socratic method of debate
hard to distinguish real from imitation
bizarre/paradoxical/a paradox (from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子)
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
